intro: Microlicia itambana, commonly known as the Itambana tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage. The plant typically grows as a medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 20 meters, with smooth, greyish bark. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical in shape, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
